title: The Republic
creator: Plato; Jowett, Benjamin, 1817-1893
subject: Political Science -- Early Works to 1800; Justice (Philosophy) -- Early Works to 1800; Utopias -- Early Works to 1800
description: A philosophical dialogue concerning the nature of justice and its role in public life. It includes an outline of an idealized city-state exploring the applications of justice.

title: Politics
creator: Aristotle; Ellis, William, 1730-1801
subject: Political Science -- Early Works to 1800
description: A work of political philosophy that examines various real and idealized constitutions, ultimately categorizing them into six typologies.

title: The Republic of Cicero
creator: Cicero, Marcus Tullius; Featherstonhaugh, George William, 1780-1866
subject: Political Science -- Early Works to 1800; State, The -- Early Works to 1800
description: A philosophical dialogue explaining the development of the constitution and consitutional theory of the Roman Republic from it's mythologized beginning to the Late Republican Period.
coverage: Roman Republic and Empire -- Italia, 1st Century BCE

title: Discourses on Livy
creator: Machiavelli, Niccolo, 1469-1527; Thomson, Ninian Hill
subject: Political Science -- Early Works to 1800; Historians -- Rome
description: A work of political history, focusing on the expansion of the Roman Republic on the Italian Peninsula and its lessons for contemporary rulers and leaders.

title: The Social Contract and Discourses
creator: Rousseau, Jean-Jacques, 1712- 1778; Cole, G.D.H. (George Douglas Howard), 1889-1959
subject: Social Contract; Political Science -- Early Works to 1800
description: A work of political philosophy that attempts to establish the legitimacy of political authority in a community from first principles. It explores the idea of the common good and membership in a political community.

title: The Spirit of Laws
creator: Montesquieu, Charles de Secondat, baron de, 1689- 1755; Nugent, Thomas, 1700?-1772
subject: Political Science -- Early Works to 1800; Law -- Comparative
description: A treatise on comparative law and normative constitutional law that advocates for a separation between the powers of government. Additionally, it analyzes the public lives and geographies of various peoples, and their ideal constitutions.

title: Democracy in America, Vol. 1
creator: Tocqueville, Alexis de, 1805-1859; Reeve, Henry, 1813-1895
subject: Democracy; United States -- Politics and Government; United States -- Social Conditions -- to 1865
description: A work of political sociology examining the United States of the early 19th century and comparing it to French society. The work draws attention to the sociological characteristics of a people as an aspect of determining its larger political character.

title: Democracy in America, Vol. 2
creator: Tocqueville, Alexis de, 1805-1859; Reeve, Henry, 1813-1895
subject: Democracy; United States -- Politics and Government; United States -- Social Conditions -- to 1865
description: A work of political sociology examining the United States of the early 19th century and comparing it to French society. The work draws attention to the sociological characteristics of a people as an aspect of determining its larger political character.

title: Utopia
creator: More, Thomas, Saint, 1478-1535; Morley, Henry
subject: Utopias -- Early Works to 1800
description: A fiction book that uses its narrative as a device for political satire of contemporary governments. It outlines a fictionalized island, its people, and their customs and government.

title: The Histories of Polybius, Vol. 1
creator: Polybius; Hultsch, Friedrich Otto, 1833-1906
subject: History, Ancient
description: A work of political and military history that seeks to explain the success of the Roman Republic in dominating its neighbors. The work seeks to show the development of the Roman consitution and highlight its unique aspects.
coverage: Roman Republic and Empire -- Italia, 2nd Century BCE

title: The Histories of Polybius, Vol. 2
creator: Polybius; Hultsch, Friedrich Otto, 1833-1906
subject: History, Ancient
description: A work of political and military history that seeks to explain the success of the Roman Republic in dominating its neighbors. The work seeks to show the development of the Roman consitution and highlight its unique aspects.
coverage: Roman Republic and Empire -- Italia, 2nd Century BCE

title: The Commonwealth of Oceana
creator: Harrington, James, 1611-1677
subject: Utopias -- Early Works to 1800; Republics
description: A work of political philosophy discussing the ideal governmennt of a fictionalized country. The work indirectly comments on the contemporary politics of the Oliver Cromwell's Great Britain.

title: Rights of Man
creator: Paine, Thomas, 1737-1809; Conway, Moncure Daniel, 1832-1907
subject: France -- History -- Revolution, 1789-1799 -- Causes
description: A work of political commentary and philosophy concerning the early events of the French Revolution, that advocates for the legitimacy of political revolution. The work explores ideas of political authority and natural rights of a political community.

title: The Federalist, on the new Constitution
creator: Hamilton, Alexander, 1757-1804; Madison, James, 1751-1836; Jay, John, 1745-1829
subject: Constitutional History -- United States
description: A series of essays originally published under a pseudonym aiming to defend the unratified Constitution and advoate for its ratification by New York.

title: Considerations on Representative Government
creator: Mill, Stuart John, 1806-1873
subject: Representative Government and Representation
description: A book of political philosophy that advocates for representative government as the ideal form for balancing political interests and including the population in their own governance.

title: A Vindication of the Rights of Men
creator: Wollstonecraft, Mary, 1759-1797
subject: Human Rights -- Early Works to 1800; France -- History -- Revolution, 1789-1799 -- Causes
description: A political pamphlet defending the republican aims of the French Revolution against aristocratic critiques. The pamphlet also concerns the moral virtues and vices that diffferent socio-political systems engender.

title: A Vindication of the Rights of Woman
creator: Wollstonecraft, Mary, 1759-1797
subject: Women's Rights -- Great Britain; Women -- Education -- Great Britain
description: An essay of political philosophy arguing for the education of women matching their societal position. Ultimately, the author believes that the education of women will benefit the country.

title: Perpetual Peace
creator: Kant, Immanuel, 1724-1804; Smith, Mary Campbell
subject: Political Science; Peace
description: A work of international politics and political philosophy that advocates for republican government and cosmopolitanism. The aim of the work is to establish a baseline from which to build universal peace.
